summary: This document is the agenda for the 3rd Annual Suffolk County Campus Sexual Assault Prevention 'Enough is Enough' Collaborative Conference held virtually on April 15, 2021. It lists speakers and presentation topics, including a session titled 'Civil Litigation of Sexual Abuse Claims —Jeffrey Epstein Case Study' presented by attorneys Bradley J. Edwards and Brittany Henderson.

persons.name: Laura A. Ahearn
persons.role: Executive Director of CVC (Crime Victims Center)
persons.context: She is listed as the speaker for the conference introduction.

persons.name: Kathy Hochul
persons.context: She is listed as the keynote speaker for the conference.

persons.name: Steve Bellone
persons.context: He is listed as a guest speaker for the conference.

persons.name: Timothy Sini
persons.context: He is listed as a guest speaker for the conference.

persons.name: Christina Vargas
persons.role: Chief Diversity Officer & Title IX Coordinator at Suffolk County Community College
persons.context: She is listed as a speaker giving a 'Title IX Overview'.

persons.name: Daniel Sullivan
persons.context: He is listed as a co-presenter on 'Assessment and Intervention of PTSD' from Hofstra University.

persons.name: Stephanie Grimaldi
persons.context: She is listed as a co-presenter on 'Assessment and Intervention of PTSD' from Hofstra University.

persons.name: Valentina Stoycheva
persons.context: She is listed as the presenter on 'The Intersection of Trauma, Addiction, and Eating Disorders'.

persons.name: Eric Aboulafia
persons.context: He is listed as a co-presenter on 'An Overview of NY State Sex Crimes and Consent' from the Suffolk County District Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Bradley J. Edwards
persons.role: Founding Partner at Edwards Pottinger LLC
persons.context: He is listed as a co-presenter of the session 'Civil Litigation of Sexual Abuse Claims —Jeffrey Epstein Case Study'.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: She is listed as a co-presenter of the session 'Civil Litigation of Sexual Abuse Claims —Jeffrey Epstein Case Study'.

connections.description: Both are partners at the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC and are co-presenting a session on the Jeffrey Epstein case study.
Both are Assistant District Attorneys in the Suffolk County District Attorney's Office and are co-presenting a session on NY State sex crimes.
Both are Clinical Psychology Doctoral Students at Hofstra University and are co-presenting a session on PTSD.
Timothy Sini is the Suffolk County District Attorney, and Eric Aboulafia is an Assistant District Attorney in his office.
Timothy Sini is the Suffolk County District Attorney, and Melissa Grier is an Assistant District Attorney in his office.

events.title: 3rd Annual Suffolk County Campus Sexual Assault Prevention Conference
events.description: A virtual conference titled 'Enough is Enough' focused on sexual assault prevention, featuring various speakers and presentations, including one on the Jeffrey Epstein case.

keyFacts: The agenda includes a specific session titled 'Civil Litigation of Sexual Abuse Claims —Jeffrey Epstein Case Study' presented by attorneys Bradley J. Edwards and Brittany Henderson.
The conference was hosted by the Crime Victims Center (CVC) and involved collaboration with organizations like Parents for Megan's Law and Brighter Tomorrows, Inc.
High-profile political figures, including Lieutenant Governor Kathy Hochul and Suffolk County Executive Steve Bellone, were featured as speakers.
The conference covered a wide range of topics related to sexual assault, trauma, Title IX, and legal procedures, indicating a broad educational and prevention focus.
The document itself is a conference agenda and does not contain details of the Epstein case study presentation content.
